Happy Teacher Appreciation Week to BRHS Teacher Logan O'Brien. A fellow teacher described Coach O'Brien as the energizer bunny and forever the biggest cheerleader and motivator for our students. On a typical day at school, he spends his lunchtime gathering students who have missing work and encouraging struggling students to keep working. He works hard to build and maintain relationships with all students, and that is evident during distance learning when he is calling students joining our Hangouts to stay in touch. He knows that failure at any level is not an ending point, it's just a learning experience to motivate you to try harder next time!

We appreciate you Coach O'Brien! #ThankATeacher #TeachersCan #BRISDpride

Blue Ridge ISD is proud to introduce our new Athletic Director and Head Football Coach. The Board unanimously approved Mark Chester as the Blue Ridge ISD AD/Head Football Coach. Mr. Chester has 15 years of coaching experience. In his most recent role as Assistant Head Coach/Defensive Coordinator for San Angelo Central High School, Mr. Chester helped guide the team to 7 District Championships and multiple playoff runs.

Mr. Chester brings a process-oriented approach to leading the athletic program. With a focus on building mental and physical toughness, Mr. Chester believes in high expectations coupled with high support from dedicated coaches to help each athlete achieve his or her potential.

Mr. Chester is married to Crystal, an elementary school teacher. They have three children ages 4, 7, and 9. We are excited to have the Chester family in Blue Ridge.
